content.raw:
It looks like everyone above has posted some great advice. I would remove `subt_seed` code as soon as you get your own code working as it may interfere \(although it sounds like you’ve modified it a good bit\). I concur with Hector here, the recommended way to launch a large number of ROS nodes is by using launch files to launch all of your nodes together although having a script such as `python subt/wait_for_sensors.py` to listen for sensors then exit is a good idea and might remove the need for the sleep. Although, the bridge should be up so I don’t believe you’ll have to add those sleeps in for Cloudsim.

It sounds as if you’re making progress though and you’ve started to get everything working. Please keep pinging back on this issue with additional questions/issues.
